newsArray.title: English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches
creator: Simon Jennings
newsArray.description: Reigning English Premier League champions Manchester City face fresh allegations over financial breaches dating back 14 years. The post English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches appeared first on Daily Maverick.
newsArray.content: The English Premier League has referred Manchester City to an independent commission over more than 100 alleged breaches of finance rules since the club was acquired by the Abu Dhabi-based City Football Group. The referral came weeks before the expected publication of a government white paper set to recommend the establishment of an independent regulator in English soccer to deal with the gameâ€™s finances, club ownership and corporate governance. City, the worldâ€™s highest revenue-generating club last season, according to Deloitte, are alleged to have committed multiple financial breaches between 2009 and 2018, the league said on Monday. League rules state that charges such as those faced by City could, if proven, result in a club being expelled from the Premier League in the worst-case scenario. Offending clubs may alternatively be deducted points, fined or reprimanded. While it remains to be seen what sanctions the commission imposes on City, a stricter stance by the Premier League on club finances could deter potential investors in clubs like Manchester United, according to a sports finance lawyer. Both Manchester United and Liverpool are seeking new investors, in large part due to Middle Eastern investment in clubs such as City and Newcastle United and the collapse of a planned Super League, industry experts have told Reuters. City, who were acquired by City Football Group in 2008, are also charged with failing to cooperate with the Premier Leagueâ€™s investigation, which was launched in December 2018. City are alleged to have breached rules relating to the provision of accurate financial information, â€œin particular with respect to its revenue (including sponsorship revenue), its related parties and its operating costsâ€, the league said. The club, which has won the Premier League title six times since the Abu Dhabi takeover, said it was surprised by the leagueâ€™s â€œissuing of these alleged breachesâ€. â€œThe club welcomes the review of this matter by an independent commission, to impartially consider the comprehensive body of irrefutable evidence that exists in support of its position,â€ City added . The charges stem from a Premier League investigation into Cityâ€™s financial dealings launched four years ago, after the release of a tranche of â€œFootball Leaksâ€ documents obtained by the German publication Der Spiegel . Visit Daily Maverickâ€™s home page for more news, analysis and investigations City were subsequently banned from the Champions League by the European governing body, Uefa, for two years, but successfully appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS), which overturned the ban in 2020. The club was fined â‚¬30-million by Uefa, which the CAS reduced to â‚¬10-million. In addition to the charges relating to the clubâ€™s revenue and operating costs, City are also alleged to have not fully disclosed managerial remuneration from 2009 to 2013, when Roberto Mancini was manager. The club is also charged with failing to comply with Premier League rules requiring clubs to follow Uefaâ€™s financial fair play (FFP) regulations from 2013 to 2018 and failing to follow the Premier Leagueâ€™s rules on profit and sustainability from 2015 to 2018. FFP regulations are designed to stop clubs from running up big losses through spending on players. They also ensure sponsorship deals are based on their real market value and are genuine commercial agreements â€” and not ways for owners to pump cash into a club to get around the rules. â€œThe proceedings before the Commission will â€¦ be confidential and heard in private,â€ the Premier League said in a statement . â€œThe Premier League will be making no further comment in respect of this matter until further notice.â€ Reuters/ DM

newsArray.title: Former Uganda Cranes Captain Sekagya named Head Coach at New York Red Bulls II
creator: Ismael Kiyonga
newsArray.description: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of [â€¦] The post Former Uganda Cranes Captain Sekagya named Head Coach at New York Red Bulls II appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of 17 matches in this capacity. â€œIbrahim [Sekagya] has played a crucial role in the development of Red Bulls II in addition to his success as a player with the main club,â€ Sporting Director Denis Hamlett said as quoted by the club website. â€œWe know he will continue his hard work and dedication to improve in every facet of the club.â€ The former KCCA defender who also featured for RB Salzburg in Austria as well as having a long stint in Argentina has been at the club since his retirement as a player in 2015. â€œI am thrilled to continue my journey with the New York Red Bulls organization and lead New York Red Bulls II to success,â€ Head Coach Ibrahim Sekagya said. NEWS: officially name Ibrahim Sekagya as head coach for the upcoming MLS NEXT Pro season. ğŸ“° | Link: â€œI cannot wait to get this season started and show all of the work that has been done this winter to put a well-balanced squad on the pitch.â€ The bald headed former centre back is a winner as he lifted three Austrian Football Bundesliga titles between 2008 and 2012 and was also part of the team that won the 2012 Austrian Cup. He joined the New York Red Bulls in July of 2013 and spent two seasons with the club. Sekagya was part of the 2013 Red Bulls team that clinched the clubâ€™s first-ever Supportersâ€™ Shield.

newsArray.title: Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on
creator: Ismael Kiyonga
newsArray.description: Results URA has become the fourth top tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match [â€¦] The post Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: URA has become the fourth top-tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match penalty shootout, the four-time league champions missed twice to bow out at the round of 64. A difficult day at the office as we bow out on penalties 4-3 after a two all draw in normal time. Our focus now shifts to the Startimes Uganda Premier League | | | Sam Timbeâ€™s men join Arua Hill, Maroons and Gaddafi who have also been eliminated at this stage and most likely Busoga United who failed to honour their fixture. Elsewhere, KCCA beat KJT 3-0 at Bugolobi thanks to goals from Charles Lwanga, Rogers Mato and Moses Waiswa. FULLTIME! The Cityzens progress to the round of 32 However, they ended the match with a player less after defender Geoffrey Wasswa was shown marching orders in the second half. The Kasasiro join traditional giants Express, SC Villa, Vipers, BUL, Wakiso Giants, Onduparaka, UPDF, Soltilo Bright Stars and Blacks Power among top tier sides in the next round.

newsArray.title: English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches
creator: Simon Jennings
newsArray.description: Reigning English Premier League champions Manchester City face fresh allegations over financial breaches dating back 14 years. The post English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches appeared first on Daily Maverick.
newsArray.content: The English Premier League has referred Manchester City to an independent commission over more than 100 alleged breaches of finance rules since the club was acquired by the Abu Dhabi-based City Football Group. The referral came weeks before the expected publication of a government white paper set to recommend the establishment of an independent regulator in English soccer to deal with the gameâ€™s finances, club ownership and corporate governance. City, the worldâ€™s highest revenue-generating club last season, according to Deloitte, are alleged to have committed multiple financial breaches between 2009 and 2018, the league said on Monday. League rules state that charges such as those faced by City could, if proven, result in a club being expelled from the Premier League in the worst-case scenario. Offending clubs may alternatively be deducted points, fined or reprimanded. While it remains to be seen what sanctions the commission imposes on City, a stricter stance by the Premier League on club finances could deter potential investors in clubs like Manchester United, according to a sports finance lawyer. Both Manchester United and Liverpool are seeking new investors, in large part due to Middle Eastern investment in clubs such as City and Newcastle United and the collapse of a planned Super League, industry experts have told Reuters. City, who were acquired by City Football Group in 2008, are also charged with failing to cooperate with the Premier Leagueâ€™s investigation, which was launched in December 2018. City are alleged to have breached rules relating to the provision of accurate financial information, â€œin particular with respect to its revenue (including sponsorship revenue), its related parties and its operating costsâ€, the league said. The club, which has won the Premier League title six times since the Abu Dhabi takeover, said it was surprised by the leagueâ€™s â€œissuing of these alleged breachesâ€. â€œThe club welcomes the review of this matter by an independent commission, to impartially consider the comprehensive body of irrefutable evidence that exists in support of its position,â€ City added . The charges stem from a Premier League investigation into Cityâ€™s financial dealings launched four years ago, after the release of a tranche of â€œFootball Leaksâ€ documents obtained by the German publication Der Spiegel . Visit Daily Maverickâ€™s home page for more news, analysis and investigations City were subsequently banned from the Champions League by the European governing body, Uefa, for two years, but successfully appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS), which overturned the ban in 2020. The club was fined â‚¬30-million by Uefa, which the CAS reduced to â‚¬10-million. In addition to the charges relating to the clubâ€™s revenue and operating costs, City are also alleged to have not fully disclosed managerial remuneration from 2009 to 2013, when Roberto Mancini was manager. The club is also charged with failing to comply with Premier League rules requiring clubs to follow Uefaâ€™s financial fair play (FFP) regulations from 2013 to 2018 and failing to follow the Premier Leagueâ€™s rules on profit and sustainability from 2015 to 2018. FFP regulations are designed to stop clubs from running up big losses through spending on players. They also ensure sponsorship deals are based on their real market value and are genuine commercial agreements â€” and not ways for owners to pump cash into a club to get around the rules. â€œThe proceedings before the Commission will â€¦ be confidential and heard in private,â€ the Premier League said in a statement . â€œThe Premier League will be making no further comment in respect of this matter until further notice.â€ Reuters/ DM

newsArray.title: Former Uganda Cranes Captain Sekagya named Head Coach at New York Red Bulls II
creator: Ismael Kiyonga
newsArray.description: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of [â€¦] The post Former Uganda Cranes Captain Sekagya named Head Coach at New York Red Bulls II appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of 17 matches in this capacity. â€œIbrahim [Sekagya] has played a crucial role in the development of Red Bulls II in addition to his success as a player with the main club,â€ Sporting Director Denis Hamlett said as quoted by the club website. â€œWe know he will continue his hard work and dedication to improve in every facet of the club.â€ The former KCCA defender who also featured for RB Salzburg in Austria as well as having a long stint in Argentina has been at the club since his retirement as a player in 2015. â€œI am thrilled to continue my journey with the New York Red Bulls organization and lead New York Red Bulls II to success,â€ Head Coach Ibrahim Sekagya said. NEWS: officially name Ibrahim Sekagya as head coach for the upcoming MLS NEXT Pro season. ğŸ“° | Link: â€œI cannot wait to get this season started and show all of the work that has been done this winter to put a well-balanced squad on the pitch.â€ The bald headed former centre back is a winner as he lifted three Austrian Football Bundesliga titles between 2008 and 2012 and was also part of the team that won the 2012 Austrian Cup. He joined the New York Red Bulls in July of 2013 and spent two seasons with the club. Sekagya was part of the 2013 Red Bulls team that clinched the clubâ€™s first-ever Supportersâ€™ Shield.

newsArray.title: Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on
creator: Ismael Kiyonga
newsArray.description: Results URA has become the fourth top tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match [â€¦] The post Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: URA has become the fourth top-tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match penalty shootout, the four-time league champions missed twice to bow out at the round of 64. A difficult day at the office as we bow out on penalties 4-3 after a two all draw in normal time. Our focus now shifts to the Startimes Uganda Premier League | | | Sam Timbeâ€™s men join Arua Hill, Maroons and Gaddafi who have also been eliminated at this stage and most likely Busoga United who failed to honour their fixture. Elsewhere, KCCA beat KJT 3-0 at Bugolobi thanks to goals from Charles Lwanga, Rogers Mato and Moses Waiswa. FULLTIME! The Cityzens progress to the round of 32 However, they ended the match with a player less after defender Geoffrey Wasswa was shown marching orders in the second half. The Kasasiro join traditional giants Express, SC Villa, Vipers, BUL, Wakiso Giants, Onduparaka, UPDF, Soltilo Bright Stars and Blacks Power among top tier sides in the next round.

newsArray.title: English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches
creator: Simon Jennings
newsArray.description: Reigning English Premier League champions Manchester City face fresh allegations over financial breaches dating back 14 years. The post English Premier League charges Manchester City over alleged financial rule breaches appeared first on Daily Maverick.
newsArray.content: The English Premier League has referred Manchester City to an independent commission over more than 100 alleged breaches of finance rules since the club was acquired by the Abu Dhabi-based City Football Group. The referral came weeks before the expected publication of a government white paper set to recommend the establishment of an independent regulator in English soccer to deal with the gameâ€™s finances, club ownership and corporate governance. City, the worldâ€™s highest revenue-generating club last season, according to Deloitte, are alleged to have committed multiple financial breaches between 2009 and 2018, the league said on Monday. League rules state that charges such as those faced by City could, if proven, result in a club being expelled from the Premier League in the worst-case scenario. Offending clubs may alternatively be deducted points, fined or reprimanded. While it remains to be seen what sanctions the commission imposes on City, a stricter stance by the Premier League on club finances could deter potential investors in clubs like Manchester United, according to a sports finance lawyer. Both Manchester United and Liverpool are seeking new investors, in large part due to Middle Eastern investment in clubs such as City and Newcastle United and the collapse of a planned Super League, industry experts have told Reuters. City, who were acquired by City Football Group in 2008, are also charged with failing to cooperate with the Premier Leagueâ€™s investigation, which was launched in December 2018. City are alleged to have breached rules relating to the provision of accurate financial information, â€œin particular with respect to its revenue (including sponsorship revenue), its related parties and its operating costsâ€, the league said. The club, which has won the Premier League title six times since the Abu Dhabi takeover, said it was surprised by the leagueâ€™s â€œissuing of these alleged breachesâ€. â€œThe club welcomes the review of this matter by an independent commission, to impartially consider the comprehensive body of irrefutable evidence that exists in support of its position,â€ City added . The charges stem from a Premier League investigation into Cityâ€™s financial dealings launched four years ago, after the release of a tranche of â€œFootball Leaksâ€ documents obtained by the German publication Der Spiegel . Visit Daily Maverickâ€™s home page for more news, analysis and investigations City were subsequently banned from the Champions League by the European governing body, Uefa, for two years, but successfully appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS), which overturned the ban in 2020. The club was fined â‚¬30-million by Uefa, which the CAS reduced to â‚¬10-million. In addition to the charges relating to the clubâ€™s revenue and operating costs, City are also alleged to have not fully disclosed managerial remuneration from 2009 to 2013, when Roberto Mancini was manager. The club is also charged with failing to comply with Premier League rules requiring clubs to follow Uefaâ€™s financial fair play (FFP) regulations from 2013 to 2018 and failing to follow the Premier Leagueâ€™s rules on profit and sustainability from 2015 to 2018. FFP regulations are designed to stop clubs from running up big losses through spending on players. They also ensure sponsorship deals are based on their real market value and are genuine commercial agreements â€” and not ways for owners to pump cash into a club to get around the rules. â€œThe proceedings before the Commission will â€¦ be confidential and heard in private,â€ the Premier League said in a statement . â€œThe Premier League will be making no further comment in respect of this matter until further notice.â€ Reuters/ DM

newsArray.description: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of [â€¦] The post Former Uganda Cranes Captain Sekagya named Head Coach at New York Red Bulls II appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: MLL Next Pro side New York Red Bulls II has named former Uganda Cranes skipper Ibrahim Sekagya as its head coach for their inaugural season in MLS Next Pro. Sekagya has been assistant coach at the United States club for eight seasons and recently worked as interim head last season and was in charge of 17 matches in this capacity. â€œIbrahim [Sekagya] has played a crucial role in the development of Red Bulls II in addition to his success as a player with the main club,â€ Sporting Director Denis Hamlett said as quoted by the club website. â€œWe know he will continue his hard work and dedication to improve in every facet of the club.â€ The former KCCA defender who also featured for RB Salzburg in Austria as well as having a long stint in Argentina has been at the club since his retirement as a player in 2015. â€œI am thrilled to continue my journey with the New York Red Bulls organization and lead New York Red Bulls II to success,â€ Head Coach Ibrahim Sekagya said. NEWS: officially name Ibrahim Sekagya as head coach for the upcoming MLS NEXT Pro season. ğŸ“° | Link: â€œI cannot wait to get this season started and show all of the work that has been done this winter to put a well-balanced squad on the pitch.â€ The bald headed former centre back is a winner as he lifted three Austrian Football Bundesliga titles between 2008 and 2012 and was also part of the team that won the 2012 Austrian Cup. He joined the New York Red Bulls in July of 2013 and spent two seasons with the club. Sekagya was part of the 2013 Red Bulls team that clinched the clubâ€™s first-ever Supportersâ€™ Shield.

newsArray.title: Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on
creator: Ismael Kiyonga
newsArray.description: Results URA has become the fourth top tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match [â€¦] The post Stanbic Uganda Cup: Early exit for URA as KCCA march on appeared first on Kawowo Sports.
newsArray.content: URA has become the fourth top-tier side to be eliminated from the 2022-23 Stanbic Uganda Cup after falling to regional league outfit UPU in Buhinga. The tax collectors who are yet to hit top gear in the StarTimes Uganda Premier League exited on penalties after drawing 2-2 in normal time. In the post-match penalty shootout, the four-time league champions missed twice to bow out at the round of 64. A difficult day at the office as we bow out on penalties 4-3 after a two all draw in normal time. Our focus now shifts to the Startimes Uganda Premier League | | | Sam Timbeâ€™s men join Arua Hill, Maroons and Gaddafi who have also been eliminated at this stage and most likely Busoga United who failed to honour their fixture. Elsewhere, KCCA beat KJT 3-0 at Bugolobi thanks to goals from Charles Lwanga, Rogers Mato and Moses Waiswa. FULLTIME! The Cityzens progress to the round of 32 However, they ended the match with a player less after defender Geoffrey Wasswa was shown marching orders in the second half. The Kasasiro join traditional giants Express, SC Villa, Vipers, BUL, Wakiso Giants, Onduparaka, UPDF, Soltilo Bright Stars and Blacks Power among top tier sides in the next round.
